titleStmt.title: The great designs of parliaments, have ever been, when duties are granted, that the subjects may have as little trouble and disturbance from the officers and collectors as is possible: and therefore, the consideration of what followeth, is humbly offered and presented to the honourable House of Commons, before passing the Act for a duty to be laid upon houses & windows.
titleStmt.author: Canning, William, fl. 1686-1690.

notesStmt.note: Signed at end: W.C. = William Canning.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
